statement.tex: \\ \text{Which of the following shows the correct}\\ \text{way to re-write }\int\dfrac{x+2}{\sqrt{x^2+2x+3}}dx?
\\ \text{If }M = \frac{1}{2}\int\dfrac{2x+2}{x^2+2x+3}dx, \\ \text{then has M been evaluated correctly below?}
\\ \text{And so, is this the final answer?}

reason.tex: \int t^{n} dt = \dfrac{t^{n+1}}{n+1} + C.\text{In this case, }n=-\frac{1}{2}.\\ \therefore \frac{1}{2}\int\dfrac{dt}{\sqrt{t}} = \frac{1}{2}\cdot\frac{1}{\frac{1}{2}}t^{\frac{1}{2}} = \sqrt{t} + C_1
